definition: (in former times) to escort the emperor (or other important personage)/(nowadays) to escort sb (usually jocular)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

sentences.english: A hundred knights and a thousand soldiers escorted the Princess Helena.
sentences.chinese: 一百名騎士和一千名士兵爲海倫納公主保駕。

sentences.english: Teachers to do a guide, students can learn self-protect.

sentences.english: Ghosts of Lost Souls at Sea to be Shepherded Through the Watery Passageway.

sentences.english: Select Jinxing Central Asia, to protect you, the user first choice.

sentences.english: In short courageous love is the love of weapons escort.

sentences.english: They arrive on foreign shores with the security of a job and a salary.

sentences.english: The construction of new socialist countryside needs to be escorted and convoyed by law.
sentences.chinese: 社會主義新農村建設，需要法治保駕護航。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To develop a method for the determination the ursolic acid in Baojia capsules.
